title: The new James Bond movie has three different endings
text:
The new James Bond movie has three different endings

Cape Town – The makers of the new James Bond movie - No Time To Die - have filmed three different endings to avoid spoilers being leaked.

Director Cary Joji Fukunaga – the first American to helm a Bond film – is reportedly the only person who knows which cut will be used, not even Daniel Craig knows.

A source told The Mirror that 'everyone is in the dark and that the secrecy is off the chart'.

In the upcoming film Bond has left active service and is enjoying a tranquil life in Jamaica. His peace is short-lived when his old friend Felix Leiter from the CIA turns up asking for help. The mission to rescue a kidnapped scientist turns out to be far more treacherous than expected, leading Bond onto the trail of a mysterious villain armed with dangerous new technology.

This will be Daniel's last outing as the titular character. Earlier the week it was announced that the 51-year-old is the longest-serving James Bond.

READ MORE: Daniel Craig overtakes Roger Moore to become the longest-serving James Bond

Compiled by Leandra Engelbrecht. (Sources: Bang ShowBiz, The Mirror, Channel24)
description: The makers of the new James Bond movie have filmed three different endings to avoid spoilers being leaked.
